page.title: 09WORTHEN VILLAGE HALL
page.content: The Worthen village hall was built in 1977 at a cost of Â£34,773.It replaced the British Legion Hall which was built just after World War I.The Legion Hall was a large wooden hut,but the present hall is built of brick under a tile roof.The hall has one large room, entrance hall,kitchen/bar, committee room,two store rooms,toilets and a shower.An extension was built in 1982 as a doctor's surgery and waiting room.This extension was awarded a Village Venture Award in 1983.Next to the Worthen Village Hall is the Powell -Dicken Field given as an amenity to the community in 1927,it is mainly used as a football pitch and as a children's playing field.
